meanings.definition: A right or privilege belonging to a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: In the royal family, the crown prince receives the appanage of inheriting the throne.
meanings.sent2: The appanage of being the team captain comes with great responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel claimed the appanage of the biggest acorn in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an appanage that set her apart from the rest of the group.
meanings.sent5: The appanage of freedom is cherished by all living beings.

meanings.definition: A source of revenue or profit.
meanings.sent1: Investing in stocks can be a risky appanage for some individuals.
meanings.sent2: The small bakery became the main appanage for the family's income.
meanings.sent3: The lemonade stand was a sweet appanage for the kids' savings.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity proved to be a valuable appanage in her freelance business.
meanings.sent5: The appanage of hard work is often a successful outcome.

meanings.definition: A subsidiary or dependent part of a larger entity.
meanings.sent1: The small island is considered an appanage of the mainland country.
meanings.sent2: The local branch of the company serves as an appanage to the main headquarters.
meanings.sent3: The tiny flower was an appanage to the grand garden in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The appanage of the small town was its close-knit community.
meanings.sent5: The appanage of the satellite office is to support the main operations.
